original_title: Blowback: The 9/11 Wars in Global Film
overview: A dynamic exploration of the representation of the wars in Iraq (2003-2011) and Afghanistan (2001-) in world cinema which argues that films function as resonant cultural artefacts that shape how the conflicts come to be understood and remembered by audiences at the time and those of generations to come.
title: Blowback: The 9/11 Wars in Global Film
